extracted-table.table-caption: Characteristics for the full cohort (N = 37) for neonates with and without white matter injury (WMI).

caption.p: Characteristics for the full cohort (N = 37) for neonates with and without white matter injury (WMI).

fn.p: Probability values provide results using t-test for continuous measures and Chi-square tests for categorical measures comparing the data from neonates with and without WMI. GA, gestational age; PMA, postmenstrual age; IQR, interquartile range; SD, standard deviation; IVH, intraventricular haemorrhage; PVL, Periventricular leukomalacia; mm, millimeters; †mean WMI volume; †† grade 2–4 IVH; a, one infant also had a culture positive infection; b, one infant also had a clinical infection.

extracted-table.table-caption: WMI volumes extracted from white-matter fibre pathways.

caption.p: WMI volumes extracted from white-matter fibre pathways.

fn.p: Average WMI volumes in white-matter fibre pathways assessed in a neonatal template MRI. Probability values provide results using general linear models comparing WMI injury volumes extracted from the white matter fibre pathways in the JHU-neonatal atlas in neonates with WMI, adjusting for total cerebral volumes. mm, millimeters; SD, standard deviation.
